info.author: Gabriele Giorgetti
classifiers: License :: OSI Approved :: GNU General Public License (GPL)
info.description:
Cpuspeedy allows you to change the clock speed and voltage of CPUs using Linux's
CPUFreq driver. It is a user space program, so it will work on every processor
supported by the kernel's CPUFreq driver.
All you need is a supported CPU and a kernel which has the CPUFreq driver
compiled in. Cpuspeedy is a user space program, so it will work on every
processor supported by the kernel's CPUFreq driver.
Use it and you should save battery consumption and reduce the temperature of
your laptop.
info.name: cpuspeedy
info.summary: Cpuspeedy is a simple tool written in Python which allows you to change the clock speed and voltage of the CPUs using the Linux's CPUFreq driver.
info.html_description: Cpuspeedy allows you to change the clock speed and voltage of CPUs using Linux’s CPUFreq driver. It is a user space program, so it will work on every processor supported by the kernel’s CPUFreq driver. All you need is a supported CPU and a kernel which has the CPUFreq driver compiled in. Cpuspeedy is a user space program, so it will work on every processor supported by the kernel’s CPUFreq driver. Use it and you should save battery consumption and reduce the temperature of your laptop.
